This should close #16588 if I'm not mistaken.
> This should close #16588 if I'm not mistaken.\n\nThe OP has been updated.
@fanquake Anything left to do here?
what is this condition for?
We tag releases with the prepended "v", like "v0.20.0rc1".\n\nThis `if` statement just removes it on purpose to include the version string (e.g., "0.20.0rc1") into file names.
Oh, I meant the else branch

```
if [ $RECENT_TAG = $(git describe HEAD) ]; then
  if [[ $RECENT_TAG == v* ]]; then
    VERSION=${RECENT_TAG:1} # Set VERSION to release (with "v") tagged commit
  else
    VERSION=$RECENT_TAG # Set VERSION to non-release (without "v") tagged commit
  fi
else
  VERSION=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD) # Set VERSION to untagged commit
fi
DISTNAME=bitcoin-${VERSION} # Use VERSION
Why would there be a non-v* tagged commit? This should probably be an assert(false)?
It is convenient for making gitian test builds. At least, for me :)
ok, will leave this for other reviewers to bikeshed :)

> It is convenient for making gitian test builds. At least, for me :)\n\nI mentioned on IRC, however I'll just reiterate here, I'd definitely normally NACK unclear/undocumented additions to our build system / release scripts. However given that this should be removed in a follow up PR I think it's ok as is. If you've got patches that are helpful for testing, you can maintain them locally, but pl

I don't know is this is expected or changed here, but running this I see:
```bash
test/lint/lint-shell.sh

Could #17361 help? Did you have [`yq`](https://kislyuk.github.io/yq/) installed?

**The rationale for adding that addition:**\nCurrently, the `gitian-build.py` script allows to make builds from personal repos by passing the `--url` command line argument. Also a branch could be chosen. This change adds an option to point the script to a tagged commit on personal repo as well.\n
> Did you have yq installed?\n\nYes. `yq version 3.3.0`

> > Did you have yq installed?
> 
> Yes. `yq version 3.3.0`

Not [that](https://github.com/mikefarah/yq/releases) but [this](https://kislyuk.github.io/yq/) one:
```
$ brew install python-yq
```

Ref: https://pypi.org/project/yq/
